comment._content: One of the all time greats!  I just mentioned him in a comment recently and can't think where???  It's part of the "getting-old-heimers" I suffer from.

comment.author: 65361386@N05
comment._content: Interesting - although I can't find reference to a Tom Mix visit to Dublin in The Irish Times, from 1920-1929. Although there are references to his visting England twice, in 1925 and 1929. Is there any more detail about the photo?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/65361386@N05] Hmm! Have been investigating. Found the refs to England in 1925 and 1929. Checked a load of newspapers, and did find one reference to a proposed visit to Dublin, but that was late 1930s. Will keep searching. However, metadata on these W.D. Hogan photos is usually pretty reliable...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 59302818@N00
comment._content: Good Lord, am I that old???  I remember seeing some of his movies at a Sunday afternoon matinee which was run by a couple of men who travelled around the County showing films.  Incidentally Tom Mix is one of the characters featured on the sleeve of the Beatles Album - 'Sgt Pepper's Lonely Heart Club Band'
